issue.title: fix: OF launcher flash of white to a minimum (milliseconds)
issue.body:
OpenFIn Launcher has a white screen flash that occurs for approximately 2 seconds during the initial launch of the OpenFin application when there is no cached data available. The proposed fix enhances the user experience by setting the "autoShow" option in the launcher manifest JSON to false and utilizing the useEffect hook to display the page on first load instead.

This doesnt completely get rid of the flash as it seems to be something OpenFin tends to do, for example the `waitForPageLoad` desc is : "The user will experience a brief white flash until the content arrives and is rendered. This can be mitigated somewhat by setting the backgroundColor option to some other color compatible with the expected content.". 
The problem with this solution however is that it doesn't take into account theme switch

comment.body: Close this as it's not a full solution (we get the same white flash  on RT startup) .. should engage with OF about this, as it must be a common issue - also, there may be a way of determining the appropriate bg colour prior to the .show(), to prevent the flash entirely

pull_request.title: fix: OF launcher flash of white to a minimum (milliseconds)
pull_request.body:
OpenFIn Launcher has a white screen flash that occurs for approximately 2 seconds during the initial launch of the OpenFin application when there is no cached data available. The proposed fix enhances the user experience by setting the "autoShow" option in the launcher manifest JSON to false and utilizing the useEffect hook to display the page on first load instead.

This doesnt completely get rid of the flash as it seems to be something OpenFin tends to do, for example the `waitForPageLoad` desc is : "The user will experience a brief white flash until the content arrives and is rendered. This can be mitigated somewhat by setting the backgroundColor option to some other color compatible with the expected content.". 
The problem with this solution however is that it doesn't take into account theme switch

commits.message: chore: single vite build for client/workspace
chore: vite build conditionals for OF entries/html conversion
chore: remove workspace build from github workflows
chore: fix RA URL gen for 'env' deployments
chore: tidy up vite config, update vitest and friends
chore: vite mods for OF/Node 20, versions & TODO tidy

Merge pull request #2294 from AdaptiveConsulting/chore/5507-of-client-workspace-build-merge

Chore/5507 of client workspace build merge

pull_request.title: Chore/5507 of client workspace build merge
pull_request.body:
.. been waiting in the wings, this completes the transition from totally separate workspace folder to being integrated into the packages/client area
- one build
- one deploy
- fewer mistakes (I hope) - example, recent failure to launch sell-side in Workspace as the "variant" code wasn't there .. was just using `openWindow.ts` not `openWindow.openfin.ts`

comment.body:
left this here ... was going to align with RA at least, but anything 4.3.x-ish has different behaviour around the .web/.openfin/.finsemble module replacement in local dev mode 😞 
.. will tackle this when upgrading to vite 5 / vitest 1 (5617)

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -52,13 +52,10 @@
     "openfin:start:launcher": "concurrently \"npm:openfin:dev\" \"npm:openfin:run:launcher\"",
     "openfin:start:launcher:local": "concurrently \"npm:openfin:local\" \"npm:openfin:run:launcher\"",
     "openfin:build": "cross-env TARGET=openfin vite build",
-    "openfin:serve": "cross-env TARGET=openfin vite preview",
-    "openfin:start:preview": "npm:openfin:build && concurrently \"npm:openfin:serve\" \"npm:openfin:run:launcher\"",
-    "workspace:dev": "cross-env TARGET=workspace vite --config vite-ws.config.ts",
-    "workspace:build": "cross-env TARGET=workspace vite build --config vite-ws.config.ts",
-    "workspace:serve": "cross-env TARGET=workspace vite serve --config vite-ws.config.ts",
-    "workspace:run": "cross-env-shell \"wait-on -l http://localhost:2017/config/workspace.json && openfin -l -c http://localhost:2017/config/workspace.json\"",
-    "workspace:start": "concurrently \"npm:openfin:dev\" \"npm:workspace:dev\" \"npm:workspace:run\"",
+    "openfin:start:preview": "npm:openfin:build && concurrently \"npm:serve\" \"npm:openfin:run:launcher\"",
+    "workspace:run": "npm run _openfin:run --manifest_url=http://localhost:1917/workspace/config/workspace.json",
comment.body: all these "1917" fixed ports are why we had to add "strictPort" in the vite config - that and the manifest substitution ..

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,17 +1,30 @@
 type Environment = "local" | "env" | "dev" | "uat" | "prod"
 
-// Comes from vite.config - base
-// Will be / for vite development mode (local),
+// import.meta.env.BASE_URL comes from vite.config.base, unless development mode when it is "/"
 // otherwise the full domain / path of the deployment e.g. https://web.env.reactivetrader.com/pull/2064
-const BASE_URL = import.meta.env.BASE_URL
+// TODO (5636) launcher.*.reactivetrader.com should be Deprecated, but until we remove the deployment, leave the conversion
+export const BASE_URL =
+  import.meta.env.BASE_URL === "/"
